alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Kingfisher; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 3:06AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Washita, southwestern Kingfisher, northern Caddo, southeastern Custer, southern Blaine and western Canadian Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 306 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Greenfield to 6 miles southeast of Hydro to near Alfalfa. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Watonga, Hinton, Geary, Hydro, Binger, Calumet, Corn, Eakly, Gracemont, Lookeba, Colony, Bridgeport, Greenfield, Alfalfa, Cloud Chief, Fort Cobb Reservoir, Albert, Cedar Lake, and Cowden. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 80 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Kingfisher; Washita
